üìç Georgia‚Äôs President Mikheil Kavelashvili describes a new peak in relations with Armenia. üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Estonian Prime Minister Kristen Michal pledge deeper cooperation in digitalization, reforms, and EU integration during Pashinyan‚Äôs official visit to Tallinn. üìç Following activist complaints, Armenia‚Äôs Investigative Committee is probing pro-government figures over alleged hate speech targeting Nagorno-Karabakh refugees. üìç Low cost and high quality fuel Armenia‚Äôs medical tourism boom- https://youtu.be/Zfvr8LvL4U4

entry.title: Europe‚Äôs moment for building peace in the South Caucasus

media:group.media:title: Europe‚Äôs moment for building peace in the South Caucasus
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Marat Terterov, co-founder of the Brussels Energy Club and the European Geopolitical Forum, discusses the current situation of the European Union‚Äôs relations with the South Caucasian countries- Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia. He also explains his vision for regional cooperation in the South Caucasus, and the steps needed to discourage conflict and foster stability.

media:group.media:title: Why Armenia must electrify #shorts
media:group.media:description:
With around 80% of its total primary energy supply dependent on imports, Armenia faces a critical challenge in securing its energy future, making efficiency and diversification central to its strategy. An extensive electrification program could address this issue.

entry.title: Pashinyan‚Äôs Estonia visit highlights digital innovation

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan‚Äôs Estonia visit highlights digital innovation
media:group.media:description:
üìç EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas announced an upcoming visit to Armenia during a meeting with Armenian President Vahagn Khachaturyan in Rome, where both attended Pope Francis‚Äôs funeral. üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs official visit to Estonia focuses on strengthening bilateral ties, advancing Armenia-EU relations, and exploring Estonia‚Äôs digital governance model. üìç China has appointed a new ambassador to Armenia after a gap of nine months, as Armenia lags behind in building relations with Beijing.

entry.title: Low cost and high quality fuel Armenia‚Äôs medical tourism boom

media:group.media:title: Low cost and high quality fuel Armenia‚Äôs medical tourism boom
media:group.media:description:
Medical tourism has developed rapidly in Armenia in recent years. Armenians and non-Armenians living abroad are increasingly traveling to the country to gain access to various types of medical services. Currently, rhinoplasty and dentistry are the most sought-after services for foreign clients.

entry.title: US signals support for nuclear partnership as Westinghouse visits Armenia: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: US signals support for nuclear partnership as Westinghouse visits Armenia: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçU.S. Ambassador Kristina Kvien hosted executives from nuclear giant Westinghouse, as Washington seeks a major role in Yerevan‚Äôs efforts to build a new atomic power plant. üìç Armenia‚Äôs largest mine took over the domestic airline that runs flights between Yerevan and Kapan, the town nearest to the sprawling Zangezur mining site in southern Armenia. More on Zangezur‚Äôs takeover of NovAir: https://shorturl.at/UEwqc üìç Armenia began filling the newly built Vedi reservoir, which is expected to improve agricultural capacity and sustainable water management. It marks the first time the country has completed a major dam project since independence from the Soviet Union. üìç More on the state of Armenia‚Äôs water resources: https://shorturl.at/vSyWN
